ygData.subject: readers, posters, and tourneys
ygData.msgSnippet: I usually read, and occasionally post, but I don t think it s a problem that most people don t post.  Like George said, it s a good place to stay informed

I usually read, and occasionally post, but I don't think it's a problem
that most people don't post.  Like George said, it's a good place to
stay informed about new maps and stuff.  

Before we get too far into planning some sort of tournament, it might be
a good idea to take an interest survey.  I mean,  if only two people
want to participate, is it still worth doing?  While I do find time to
reply to some of these posts occasionally, I kind of doubt I would have
the time to actually participate.  By the way Daniel, how many people
are subscribed to this list out of curiousity?
I suspect I would play gladiator more often if I had people to play
with, because that's what I remember being really fun about it, sitting
down with a friend or two and trying to get through the game.  I know I
would play more if there were some sort of network capabilities, since I
have a home network and am alwayse looking for stuff that will work on a
p200 that's fun multiplayer.

I wonder how hard it would be to make a linux version . . .  if only
they would hook us with the source code.  : �
